text: Republican critics say the bill would restrict credit, hurt economic growth and create a perpetual bailout fund.
author: jacksonjk

text: The bill also includes $3 billion for unemployed homeowners at risk of foreclosure.
author: jacksonjk

text: Derivatives- like credit default swaps- would be traded publicly on exchanges to avoid future AIG's.
author: jacksonjk

text: Bill also includes measures already passed by the house on  executive compensation and allowing judges to change the terms of mortgages.
author: jacksonjk

text: Also creates Financial Stability Council to look at the entire financial system, ID threats and hold some institutions to higher standards.
author: jacksonjk

text: Companies with over $50 billion in assets would pay in to a $150 billion bailout fund.  That fund could be used to pay for future bailouts.
author: jacksonjk

text: The bill would create a new agency to monitor unfair or abusive practices on products like credit cards and payday loans.
author: jacksonjk

text: House is beginning last series of votes on regulatory reform.  The bill would be a massive overhaul of the regulatory system.
author: jacksonjk
